isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 7 Engine Service Manual - Flywheel and Flywheel Housing - Installation - Crankshaft Rear Oil Seal and Wear Sleeve

svcproc.title: Crankshaft Rear Oil Seal and Wear Sleeve

note.para: When replacing crankshaft rear oil seal, note that production engines will not have a wear sleeve. Wear sleeves are only available as a service item included with replacement crankshaft rear oil seal.

figure.caption: Orientation of crankshaft rear oil seal and wear sleeve

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not separate wear sleeve from new oil seal; this will damage seal.

note.para: Before assembly, lubricate outer diameter of crankshaft rear oil seal with a solution of dish soap and water (approximately 50/50 mix). Do not use other lubricants.

step1.para:
Put a 360° bead of hydraulic sealant, such as Loctite® 569
or equivalent, onto rear edge of crankshaft flange.

Attach hub of rear wear sleeve installer ZTSE4515
on end of crankshaft. Make sure crankshaft alignment dowel fits in recess hole in rear/wear sleeve installer hub.
Position a new crankshaft rear oil seal and wear sleeve onto rear wear sleeve installer hub.

figure.caption: Crankshaft rear oil seal and wear sleeve installation

note.para: Do not use an air impact wrench to install new crankshaft rear oil seal.

step1.para: Place forcing collar, thrust bearing, and drive nut on threaded shaft. Tighten nut until crankshaft rear oil seal bottoms out in crankshaft rear oil seal carrier.
